newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore government securities end narrowly mixed.
newsitem.headline: Singapore government securities end narrowly mixed.

text.p: Singapore government securities ended narrowly mixed in moderate trade on retail and interbank interest, dealers said on Thursday.

"The interbank rate eased slightly today but there was little impact on the market. Treasury bill yields were slightly lower but bond prices were slightly higher. Volume was moderate," a local dealer said.
In treasury bills, three-months closed at a yield of 2.48/2.43 percent compared with Wednesday's yield of 2.50/2.45 percent and one-year at a yield of 2.30/2.25 percent against 2.33/2.28 percent.
Among bonds, July 1998 ended at S$98.05/98.10 from Wednesday's close of S$97.98/98.03, September 2001 at S$96.83/96.88 versus S$96.28/96.33 and June 2003 at S$94.85/94.90 against S$94.73/94.78.
The overnight interbank offered rate eased to 3-5/8 3-1/2 percent from Wednesday's 3-11/16 3-9/16 percent.
